title: Thursday Close / Asia Early Morning
commentary: U.S. equities finished Thursday's session in the red — Dow down 0.66%, S&P 500 off 0.39% — as the post-Fed bounce ran out of steam in a broad-based retreat. Gold slipped below the psychological $5,000 level to close at exactly $5,000 (-0.19%), offering the bulls a crucial test after this week's historic run. Oil continued defying gravity at $66.53 (+2.3%) on persistent supply fears while crypto staged a modest overnight recovery — Bitcoin rallied back to $66,927 (+0.9% on 24h), though Ethereum lagged at $1,937 (-0.8%). The close sets up a pivotal Friday with gold defending the $5K handle and equities searching for direction after two days of chop.

title: US Late Session Slide
commentary: The selling intensified into the close — Dow tumbled 0.76%, S&P 500 lost 0.59%, Nasdaq dropped 0.63% — erasing Wednesday's gains in a broad-based retreat as risk appetite evaporated heading into Friday. Gold gave back most of its intraday gains but clung to the $5,010 handle, essentially flat on the day after touching the $5,034 record earlier. Oil remained stubbornly elevated at $66.49 (+2.2%), the one asset class traders seem reluctant to sell this week. Crypto drifted sideways in the wreckage — BTC $66,304 (-1.2%), ETH $1,918 (-2.7%) — with the broader digital asset complex clearly in a holding pattern awaiting a macro catalyst.

title: US Afternoon Selloff
commentary: Equities accelerated to the downside into the afternoon — S&P 500 fell 0.41%, Dow dropped 0.58% — as the early-session drift became a proper risk-off move with no single catalyst, just fading momentum after a week of mixed signals. Gold pulled back from its $5,034 intraday high but held above $5,020 (+0.23%), consolidating at nosebleed levels as bulls refuse to give ground. Crude oil remained the week's standout performer at $66.61 (+2.4%) while crypto treaded water — Bitcoin flat at $66,299 (-1.3% on 24h), ETH at $1,922 (-2.5%). The late-session weakness in equities heading into Friday could set up a cautious tone for the week's final trading day.
